name: Chinese
descriptions: The Chinese program develops competence in using Mandarin Chinese to conduct appropriate Sino-American intercultural communication. Students learn language across three instructional levels alongside dedicated culture courses, connecting with over one billion Chinese speakers globally.

China is the second-largest economy in the world and a major U.S. trading partner. Chinese speakers have a significant advantage in understanding Chinese culture and navigating international markets. Courses also satisfy requirements for the Asian Studies minor.

courses: MOLA 20003 - Cosmopolitanism: Thinking from a Global Perspective - 3 hrs. (gateway)

electiveCourses.description: Three courses taught in Chinese at the 30000+ level (at least one at 40000+), plus two courses with ARAB, CHIN, FREN, GRMN, ITAL, JAPN, or MOLA prefix (max one taught in English). May include one interdisciplinary course with advisor approval.

features: Chinese Language House residential immersion program
Mid-Autumn Festival and Chinese New Year celebrations
Courses count toward Asian Studies minor
